description_en: Restores a small amount of health.
Restores a moderate amount of health.
Fully restores health and maximizes the size of your Health Gauge.
Fully restores health and maximizes the size of your Health and Stamina Gauges.
A cure for poison.
Removes all traces of poison and restores a slight amount of health.
A mysterious berry that cures various blights.
A Guild-approved beverage that boosts your stamina. Helps shake off sleep, too!
Food that restores a bit of stamina.
Provides a moderate boost to your stamina. This one's still red in the middle.
Provides a moderate boost to your stamina and keeps it at max for a longer period. Meat done right!
Provides a small boost to your stamina. Can be eaten quickly.
Provides temporary relief from extreme heat.
Very slightly increases your maximum health level.
Slightly increases your maximum health level.
Boosts your natural ability to heal.
Juicy, dried meat made by Astera's chef. Boosts natural healing and cures bleeding.
Dulls one's sense of exhaustion. Reduces stamina depletion for a time.
Lets you dash without tiring for longer than regular dash juice does.
Temporarily strengthens your attacks when ingested by improving energy flow.
A mysterious powder that produces a cloud around the area that temporarily strengthens defense.
Highly nutritious honey. Combine this with Potions to craft Mega Potions for maximum potency.
A primary ingredient in potions.
A primary ingredient in antidotes.
A wondrous, flammable plant. Useful for crafting explosives.
This plant's leaves store a great amount of water. A component for making Water Ammo.
A plant that radiates ice-cold air. Use in combinations to create freeze ammo.
A plant containing sleeping agents. Used to craft tranquilizers.
A lightweight and extremely strong plant. Used to make nets for pitfall traps.
A nut that produces a copious amount of smoke. Combine with other items to create smoke with various properties.
A mysterious berry, rumored for eons to be loathed by dragons. Required to craft Dragon Ammo.
A mushroom infused with power-enhancing effects. Used in restorative items.
A dangerous fungus said to draw the life out of people. Beware. Required to craft Max Potions.
A hard-to-find mushroom with the power to generate blazing heat. Required to craft Gunpowder.
A very rare fungus that pulses with extreme heat. Add to a barrel bomb for a dramatically stronger blast.
A mushroom that induces paralysis. Required to craft Tranq Bombs.
A poisonous fungus. Can be used as a toxin for knives.
This one has a very strange aroma. Is it edible? Only one way to find out! Required to craft Farcasters.
This mushroom is a primary ingredient in cool drinks.
A sharp-tasting bug with innate healing abilities. Used as an ingredient in many medicines.
An insect that emits a powerful flash when it dies. Required to craft Flash Pods.
An insect said to live a millennium. Combine it with other items to add their properties to the powder.
An insect that emits electricity when struck. Required to craft Shock Traps and Thunder Ammo.
An insect used as fishing bait. A fish favorite, it practically races down the nearest gilly gullet.
While not practical when forging equipment, Kelbi horns are a vital component of many items.
A mysterious substance culled from certain monsters that increases endurance.
Can be obtained from certain large monsters. Has the ability to amplify the effects of certain medicines.
A monster organ that emits an earsplitting sonic blast when ruptured. Used to craft screamer pods.
Works with other materials to enhance their effects. Cannot be used by itself.
A hand grenade used to capture monsters ensnared in traps. Can be slammed against the ground.
Slinger ammo that flashes brightly on impact. Fire it right under a monster's nose to blind it.
Used as ammo for your slinger. Emits a harsh, high-frequency sound that can disrupt sensitive monsters.
Slinger ammo that releases a strong odor on impact. Causes certain monsters to flee.
Creates a large cloud of smoke wherever it lands.
Releases a toxic cloud of mist when used. Also popular as a household bug bomb.
Call for a wingdrake to transport you to the nearest camp. Can also be used during battles.
Meat carved from a monster. Can be cooked, combined, or used to set a trap.
Raw meat that poisons whatever eats it. Makes great bait for traps.
Raw meat that paralyzes whatever eats it. Makes great bait for traps.
Raw meat that puts whatever eats it to sleep. Makes great bait for traps.
A dangerous substance that explodes when struct or heated.
A large, empty barrel. Combine with gunpowser to make it into a bomb.
An upgraded large barrel bomb. Effective against large monsters.
A very sticky web. Used to craft pitfall traps.
A sturdy net that supports a certain amount of weight without breaking. Perfect for pitfall traps.
A must-have item for putting together pitfall traps and other kinds of traps.
A trap for catching certain large monsters. It is tripped by a heavy weight.
A trap that immobilizes a target. Use it to capture monsters.
A ball of condensed monster dung. Used to make dung pods for your slinger.
Exudes a prodigious smell. Used to make ammo for your slinger called dung pods.
A ball of bait favored by fish of the Arowana family.
A ball of bait favored by fish of the Gunpowderfish family.
A ball of bait favored by fish of the Goldenfish family.
An unusually-shaped weapon from abroad that returns to its user when thrown.
Allows you to see farther and observe from a distance.
An amulet that strengthens attacks. Just carrying this gives you demonic strength.
A charm that strengthens attacks. Its effects are amplified by the dragon parts it contains.
An amulet that increases defense. Just carrying this hardens your skin like stone.
A charm that increases defense. Its effects are amplified by the dragon parts it contains.
A nut covered in needle-like spines. Used to make spread ammo.
A nut used to make sticky ammo.
A nut that explodes on impact. Used to make wyvern ammo.
Used to make slicing ammo.
A nut that bears a spiral groove. Used to make pierce ammo.
A nut that ruptures on impact. Used to make cluster bombs.
Used to make gunpowder that increases ammo firepower.
Used to make gunpowder that greatly increases ammo firepower.
Combustible powser. Combine with level 1 ammo to raise its level.
Highly combustible powser. Combine with level 1 ammo to raise its level.
A fish fin used to sharpen weapons. Restores sharpness greatly, but good for fewer uses than a whetstone.
A fish fin used to sharpen weapons. Works better than a whetstone, and can be reused if you're lucky.
A scale from a Sushifish. Eat to restore a small amount of health. Also works to treat bleeding.
Scale from a Great Sushifish. Eat to get large health boost, a natural healing boost, and treat bleeding.
The scales of a Gunpowderfish. Combine with a large barrel bomb to dramatically increase its firepower.
The scales of a Great Gunpowderfish. Combine with a large barrel bomb to make a mega barrel bomb.
The scales of a Burst Arowana. Combine with fire herb to make a large amount of level 2 gunpowder.
The scales of a Great Burst Arowana. Combine with fire herb to make a vast amount of level 2 gunpowder.
The scales of a Bomb Arowana. Combine with fire herb to make a large amount of Lv3 gunpowder.
The scales of a Great Bomb Arowana. Combine with fire herb to make a vast amount of Lv3 gunpowder.
A regularly old empty phial. Nothing more, nothing less.
Ore that can be smelted into metal and used for many different purposes.
Ore that's more difficult to procure than Iron Ore. Produces fine metal.
An ore that yields metal superior to that of Machalite. Invaluable for making durable armor.
Ore obtained from mining outcrops. Still under research, but known to yield highly pure metal.
Ore obtained from the Elder's Recess. A mysterious metal, capable of fusing nearly any two materials together.
Crystallized microbes prized as an abrasive when forging weapons. Mainly found in the Wildspire Waste.
Crystal prized at the Smithy for use in high-grade abrasives. Mainly found in the Coral Highlands.
Mined from high rank areas. Many expect this newly-discovered crystal to usher in a new era of metalwork.
A precious and extremely hard substance with a faint glow. Sometimes used for crafting tools.
High quality Lightcrystal. Highly coveted for its rarity, it's used for only the finest of metalworking.
A magma-like deposit that only trained hands can work with. Armor made from it is first-class.
A valuable mineral used to create charms. Gives off a vibrant glow that mirrors the ocean.
A valuable mineral used to create charms. Gives off a warm, sunny glow.
A valuable mineral used to create charms. Gives off a blazing glow reminiscent of a bonfire.
A valuable mineral used to create charms. Gives off a mysterious glow that grants the holder sagely wisdom.
Reacts uniquely to heat. Fuse this to armor to improve it by a tiny amount.
Reacts uniquely to heat. Fuse this to armor to improve it by a small amount.
Reacts uniquely to heat. Fuse this to armor to improve it.
Reacts uniquely to heat. Fuse this to armor to significantly improve it.
Reacts uniquely to heat. Fuse this to armor to greatly improve it.
A bone used as crafting material. Can be found in bonepiles in the Coral Highlands and Rotten Vale.
A bone used as crafting material. Its ease of use and hardness allow it to be shaped into better gear.
A bone used as crafting material. Can be found in bonepiles in the Ancient Forest. Its size evokes a certain primal quality.
A bone used as crafting material. Can be found in bonepiles in the Wildspire Waste. Its size evokes a certain primal quality.
A bone used as crafting material. Can be found in bonepiles in the Coral Highlands. Its size evokes a certain primal quality.
A bone used as crafting material. Can be found in bonepiles in the Rotten Vale. Its size evokes a certain primal quality.
A bone used as crafting material. Can be found in bonepiles in the Elder's Recess. Its size evokes a certain primal quality.
A high quality material found in bone piles. The only remains left of a species of dragon now lost to time.
A rare material found in bonepiles in the Elder's Recess. It appears to be some kind of animal skull.
Discovered by Botanical Research. An insect with a giant horn, massive shell, and butterfly-like wings.
Suspect cloth the Tailraider Safari dug up from who-knows-where. Drips with an aura of pure evil.
A material found in bonepiles. Indispensable for both hunting and daily life.
Bone obtained from large monsters. Strong yet flexible, it's as reliable as steel or wood.
Bone obtained from large monsters. Hard to work with due to its size, but vital when crafting larger items.
Bone obtained from large monsters. Hard to obtain, but vital for crafting powerful equipment.
Bone obtained from high rank large monsters. It has a razor-sharp tip that retains its strength after forging.
Precious bone obtained from high rank large monsters. Their rarity makes them highly sought after.
A bone from an elder dragon. It exudes the great majesty of the beast that bore it.
Obtained from small fanged wyverns. Unlike wyvern claws, this is shaped to grip objects.
Material from high rank small fanged wyverns. Sharp enough that it might serve as a makeshift knife.
Material obtained from small insects. Mixes with insect gastric fluids to form adhesive.
Material from high rank insects. A rich broth made from only the thickest of monster juices.
A monster organ that contains a lethal toxin. Handle with extreme care.
A monster organ filled with an extremely potent toxin. Just touching it is dangerous.
A monster organ that contains paralyzing neurotoxins.
A monster organ filled with potent neurotoxins. A single touch can cause paralysis.
A monster organ that contains a knockout powder capable of inducing sleep.
A monster organ that contains dangerous powder. One whiff can induce a coma.
A monster organ filled with flammable powder. Handle with extreme care.
A monster organ filled with powder that ignites if it so much as touches air. Danger!
A monster organ designed to hold and preserve water.
A monster organ designed to hold and preserve copious amounts of water.
A monster internal organ, filled with extremely low temperature fluid. Handle with care.
A monster organ with tremendous freezing power. Turns its surroundings to ice.
A monster organ that can store up electricity, which is released on impact.
A monster organ that can store up large amounts of high voltage electricity.
A valuable gem that can be harvested from bird wyverns. Said to fetch a high price on the market.
Throughout a wyvern's life, impurities gather and form this peculiar gem.
Contains an unknown compound. The object of much scholarly research.
A musty hide covered in moss.
A pelt from a small animal. Used for many things, but mostly just regular clothes.
Rare pelt from a small animal. Feels wonderful to the touch and valued highly by the Commission.
Vespoid material. Obtained by carving. Used for many purposes.
Rare Vespoid material. Obtained by carving. Used for many purposes.
Vespoid material. Obtained by carving. Light and sharp, used in many weapons.
Rare Vespoid material. Obtained by carving. Light and sharp, used in many weapons.

Hornetaur material. Obtained by carving. Used for many purposes.

Gajau material. Obtained by carving. Hardy, used to craft gear.

Rare Gajau material. Obtained by carving. Hardy, used to craft gear.
